fields.name: Recommended Highlights
fields.objectives:
Purpose / Question:
Would users be interested in seeing general, trending content as recommendations in their highlights?
 
Hypothesis:
We hypothesize that generally popular content will receive high click-through rates.
 
Procedure: Allow for one highlight only to be a potential recommendation.
fields.analysis:
Analysis: https://sql.telemetry.mozilla.org/dashboard/activity-stream-a-b-testing-recommendations
 
Users blocked trending recommendations at a far greater rate than their regular highlights. This showed users were not very interested in these recommendations.
 
Conclusion:
Trending recommendations should not be a part of Activity Stream.

fields.name: Weighted Highlights
fields.objectives: Use weighted highlights instead of the query based ones.

fields.name: Local Page Scraper
fields.objectives: Locally compute metadata for pages

fields.name: Use Mozilla MetadataService
fields.objectives: Compute metadata using MetadataService

fields.name: Combine score of deduped sites
fields.objectives:
Purpose / Question:
The Activity Stream Topsites algorithm behaved differently relative to Tiles wherein visits to a site with “www” prepended vs. visits without “www” were treated differently. This resulted in sites with many visits to not show up in Topsites because we only chose the “www” prepended version which sometimes had a lower frecency attached to it. This experiment will test whether combining frecency of deduped sites affects Topsites interaction.
 
Hypothesis:
We hypothesize that combining the frecency of deduped sites will improve the Topsites algorithm and result in a larger click-through rate for Topsites without negatively affecting other interactions in Activity Stream.
 
Procedure:
The relevant code changes for this experiment are here:
https://github.com/mozilla/activity-stream/commit/5a7a384b7d66d3e12c71d322ffcaf809e63449f0
https://github.com/mozilla/activity-stream/commit/40e23068f72bea573fada1cf0ba299a6120d501e
 
This method combines frecency by summing the frecency for both “www” and non-”www” versions of a site.
fields.analysis:
Definitions:
Event Rate: The ratio of (# of distinct sessions with a certain event) / (total number of sessions)
Positive Interactions: click, search, bookmark, share
 
https://sql.telemetry.mozilla.org/dashboard/activity-stream-a-b-testing-deduped-combined-frecency
 
Based on the analysis, we have the following findings:
There is a statistically significant increase in click rate
There is a statistically significant increase in block rate
There is a statistically significant decrease in search rate
There is no statistically significant change in positive interaction rate
 
 
Conclusion:
Let’s keep this algorithm change in Activity Stream.

fields.name: Fetch Page Content Locally
fields.objectives:
Purpose / Question:
Would it be possible to completely remove dependence on a metadata service and increase metadata coverage without affecting user engagement or retention?
 
Hypothesis:
We hypothesize that by making the switch from fetching metadata from an external service, to computing metadata locally within the browser, the user will not notice a decrease in overall metadata quality nor will it negatively affect their retention or interactions in Activity Stream.
 
Procedure:
The relevant code changes for this experiment are here:
https://github.com/mozilla/activity-stream/commit/fc4e40f8df44d865ee38e19cdee49281beefe68b
 
This change fetches metadata for a website as a user browses it.

fields.name: Original about:newtab top sites
fields.objectives:
Purpose / Question:
If we showed exactly the same topsites that Tiles shows, how would that affect our click-through rate?
 
Hypothesis:
We hypothesize that since Tiles performed better in our first SHIELD study, using its algorithm will result in a larger click-through rate for Topsites without negatively affecting other interactions in Activity Stream.
 
Procedure:
The relevant code changes for this experiment are here:
https://github.com/mozilla/activity-stream/commit/2dfed5373a7a461eb85a547c61ba0b50162627cc
 
This method simply calls “NewTabUtils.links.getLinks()” to fetch the exact same links used by Tiles.
fields.analysis:
Analysis: 
https://sql.telemetry.mozilla.org/dashboard/activity-stream-a-b-testing-original-newtab-sites
 
The click-through rate is significantly lower in the experiment group. Users prefer the original algorithm rather than the Tiles algorithm 
 
Conclusion:
This experiment will not be integrated into Activity Stream. Let’s keep the original algorithm.

fields.name: Screenshots for Top Sites
fields.objectives:
Purpose / Question:
Do changes to the topsites design such as larger icons and screenshots when good icons don’t exist improve engagement?
 
Hypothesis:
We hypothesize that these design changes will result in a larger click-through rate for Topsites without negatively affecting other interactions in Activity Stream.

fields.name: Screenshots for Highlights
fields.objectives: Show a screenshot for Highlights that otherwise don't have an image
fields.analysis:
No statistical significance yet
This experiment might be impacted by “slow addon” due to screenshots

fields.analysis:
No statistical significance yet
This experiment should improve upon the last metadata one but may need to more periodic refresh of the cache
